speech:
Physical Symptoms:

    Headaches: Frequent tension or migraines.
    Muscle Tension or Pain: Tightness in the neck, shoulders, or back.
    Fatigue: Constant tiredness, even after a full nightâ€™s sleep.
    Sleep Problems: Difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or waking up feeling unrested.
    Digestive Issues: Stomach aches, indigestion, diarrhea, or constipation.
    Increased Heart Rate: Palpitations or rapid heartbeat.
    Sweating: Excessive sweating, especially in stressful situations.
    Weakened Immune System: Getting sick more often, such as colds or infections.
    Chest Pain or Pressure: Tightness in the chest or shortness of breath.
    Appetite Changes: Overeating or loss of appetite.

Emotional Symptoms:

    Irritability or Anger: Quick to anger, frustration, or irritability.
    Anxiety: Constant worry, nervousness, or panic.
    Restlessness: Feeling agitated or unable to relax.
    Sadness or Depression: Feeling overwhelmed, helpless, or hopeless.
    Mood Swings: Rapid changes in mood, from happy to sad or angry.
    Difficulty Concentrating: Struggling to focus or remember things.

Behavioral Symptoms:

    Avoidance: Withdrawing from social activities, responsibilities, or work.
    Procrastination: Putting off tasks or avoiding them completely.
    Substance Use: Using alcohol, drugs, or smoking more than usual.
    Changes in Eating Habits: Eating too much or too little as a way of coping.
    Nervous Habits: Nail biting, pacing, fidgeting, or other repetitive behaviors.

Cognitive Symptoms:

    Racing Thoughts: Feeling overwhelmed by constant or rapid thoughts.
    Negative Thinking: Pessimistic thoughts or focusing on worst-case scenarios.
    Forgetfulness: Difficulty remembering important details or tasks.
    Poor Judgment: Struggling to make decisions or often making impulsive ones.
